newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-HATTESTAD REGAINS WORLD JAVELIN TITLE.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-HATTESTAD REGAINS WORLD JAVELIN TITLE.

text.p: Norway's Trine Hattestad regained the world women's javelin title on Saturday with her opening throw of 68.78 metres.
Hattestad won the 1993 world title in Stuttgart but missed Gothenburg two years ago because she was pregnant.
The first round effort was enough for victory but behind her a fierce competition developed for the silver and bronze medals.
Australia's Joanna Stone twice improved her personal best and finished second with 66.64.
German Tanja Damaske finished third with a final round personal best of 67.12 metres.
